Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn G
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the corbigoe in December with my boyfriend. I was very apprehensive after reading the reviews on this website!! We arrived around 11am and were told that our room would not be ready until after midday. The hotel staff were very helpful. they showed us where we could leave our bags and gave us directions and advice on where to eat etc. when we arrived back in the evening we were shown to our room. it was very small but had a big double bed and a television and new ensuite bathroom. isn't that all you need really? the hotel was not noisy at all!!. in the morning we were shown to a nice breakfast room. breakfast was ok, cereal, toast and tea/coffee. a fry would have been nice but im sure not many budget hotels offer that! we only stayed for two nights and are room was cleaned and sheets changed after the 1st night. we were charged £1 to leave our bags in the hotel until we were leaving but i wouldnt complain about that!! Great base for exploring london if you are on a budget!! right beside a Pimlico underground station and very close Victoria train station!! Overall, not as bad as the reviews make out....no luxury here but not 'a dump' either!! a bit like the B&B in Eastenders!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can I rate it less than "terrible"???”
Reviews.Author: Braitauk
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviewers who are giving more than one star clearly don't care about hygiene. a friend booked a room at this hotel due to the prices. When we arrived, all I could notice was the curry smell... So we went past the reception area, went down through the stairs to the basement area, and stayed on room 1. This room has four beds, one double and three singles I believe. I could not believe how disgusting the carpets were! If you look at them with naked eyes, you will think they are ok, but once you shine a light over the carpets, you can see all sorts of gross stuff on them. I switched on my mobile phone, put the flash light on, and pointed it at the carpet at various areas around the room, the result was shocking: lots of hair, and little insects... I thought that it was horrific and totally unhygienic and unfit for habitation. I checked the beds, and they were appalling. The bed frames were probably collected from the street. In England, it is common to see people leaving old furniture outside when they are refurbishing their homes, so anyone on the street could take the furniture away. This is probably what happened with this hotel... They saw beds on the street that were going to the dumb, and then they got them and put them in the rooms. The bed linen was so gross, it was smelling of sweat and had hair all over it. The throw, cover or duvet, as I'm not even sure how to classify what was over the bedding, was at best smelly. It looked old and made me want to sneeze. It was also full of hair... Black, blonde, white, long, short... I think it had a collection of hairs from every single guest that has ever slept on that bed. Maybe Corbigoe thought it would be nice to give guests "souvenirs". The bathroom smelled clean, but it wasn't. Someone went there, splashed some bleach all over and rinsed it, the loo had urine stains, and the sink... Oh dear God, the sink! It was the first time in YEARS when I had to sleep without brushing my sink, because the faucet was disgusting! I feared about getting an infection for using that water. The faucet had stains all over it, stains from spit, from toothpaste, from lime scale, and who knows what else. The shower... Old, no pressure, gross. The heating radiator was closed so the room was pretty cold during the night. I had to put a sock around the valve and force it hard to be able to turn it to on, then it started heating the room, but that was in the morning when I had an amazing 3 hours of sleep and when I was about to leave, so not much difference. About those 3 hours of sleep... I went to bed at midnight, and couldn't sleep until 3AM because I kept feeling things walking on my body. BUGS! I felt stinging at some point, and in the morning I woke up with a red rash on my lower leg. I just could not believe it... My friend didn't read the reviews before booking the room so it is not his fault. He didn't like the room either, he also said that his bed was very gross. Both of our pillows were old, I actually removed two pillowcases to find... Pieces of old pillows stuck together. I can't stress enough how bad the stay was... Thank God it was only for a night as we only had to wait for a flight on the morning. I would not ever again stay at this hotel and neither would my friend. I would not recommend this to my worst enemy and seriously, if anybody reads reviews that says that this place is a decent place to get good sleep, this person simply did not check the room enough and does not understand about hygiene. Do yourself a favor and do not book here. You will regret it so much...

Reviews.Title: “Palmers”
Reviews.Author: Magnus P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good value for money but better beds and some egg and bacon and nutella for breakfast would improve the rating

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: Stefani F
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel we have EVER stayed at. We arrived at 9:30 am and asked to check in early (the maids were cleaning the rooms - and we saw they were all empty) they said that it wasn't possible. We then asked to use the shared shower/washroom - he said that it would cost us 20 GBP per person. Then he proceeded to say that our room was no longer available and gave us a deluxe room and charged us the difference! The guy who runs it is a crook! Also, after seeing the room we had to go to purchase bedding because there was no was we were staying sleeping on those sheets!!! GROSSSSSSSSSS!

Reviews.Title: “Never use this hotel. Disgusting hotel, disgusting service. On a reception the Hindu who deceives sits and extorts cash.”
Reviews.Author: Nataliya U Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Never use this hotel. Disgusting hotel, disgusting service. On a reception the Hindu who deceives sits and extorts cash. We have reserved this hotel through easytobook but when have arrived, on service to us have told that we бронь why that is removed and have suggested to be occupied twice more expensively, then when we began to leave has caught up with us and has told that is possible more cheaply, then we have offered расчитаться a clearing settlement, and he tried to prove to us. That on our cards there is no money, вообщем we have left therefrom and were occupied in other hotel. Never use neither this hotel nor booking system easytobook since in three days from all of us have equally written off this money from a card.

Reviews.Title: “Got a Budget? You can get better for your money!!”
Reviews.Author: Goldenkay3
Reviews.Content: 1 night stay . Our room was next to the 24 hr Reception. Staff very loud - No respect and unfriendly to Customers. Had NO sleep due to Door Bell sounding like a fog horn. No towels in the room and no spoons or milk to make tea. Window had a hole and was stuffed with tissue to stop drafts. Room smelt of Chlorine and mould on walls and ceiling. Never staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unless your desperate!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katie J
Reviews.Content: We got there were shown to our room, which had some weird makeshift step ladder up to the door, I was unwell at the time, dirty toilet, something running down bedroom walls, freezing cold, dirty bedding, concrete probably more comfortable to sleep on, although thankfully as soon as we checked in we checked out got a bit of a refund and went looking for somewhere else definitely recommend the victor which is a few doors up! Please don't go here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best choice in London for a budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: paivi_10
Reviews.Content: When I read some reviews about Corbigoe Hotel, allmost all told about "the worst hotel ever been", but still our family booked three rooms from Corbigoe because of the location and room prices. And we got what we booked: we arrived very easily to the hotel from Viktoria Station and travelled and walked around daily very easily - saving money all the time! We had good sleeps in clean sheets; it was a bit chilly at nights, but we had extra blankets in the cupboard. All our rooms had a private bathroom. Ofcourse an old and cheap hotel isn't shiny and perfect, but we did't come to London to spend our time exploring dust and bucks in a hotel. Got up early for brekfast - fell in bed exhausted late at night. Corbigoe Hotell was perfect for us for our purposes! Felt safe in the area. The stairs are so high and narrow - the luggage feels so heavy! But I think so it is in every small hotel... We did't even try the continental breakfast in the hotel for the price £2,50 because we needed full english breakfast. But there are nice cafes near to offer breakfast for a good price. The hotel charges you, if you want to leave your luggage stored for few hours after booking out of the hotel (surprised me...). But it's still cheap compared with what they charge at the stations; £8,50/item at Victoria! The staff isn't very wellcoming, but it does it's job with no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you wish to be treated rudely and stay in a dirty room!”
Reviews.Author: Marcus N
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner (we are two men) arrived at 2.30pm on Saturday where we were told that only a twin room was available and for that we would need to pay £15 extra per night. We said that we were happy with a double bed which we had booked and a call was then made by the receptionist and we were told that we had to stay ‘down the road’. We asked if the room was the same standard and that it was all Ok and we were advised that ‘yes it was a very good room and we had to stay there because the Corbigoe was full’ (despite being offered a twin room and a vacancy sign showing on the door). We were taken to The Park Hotel on 64 Belgrave Road and were taken to a room 4 floors up (very steep stairs) – Room 14. This room was a very small room with a standard double bed. The room did not have any wardrobe or hooks – so in fact no-where to hang clothes, no cupboards, drawers or shelves so no-where to place anything. The bed was made up with a single sheet on the double bed so only half the bed was covered and the mattress was exposed. A thin blanket and a sheet lay on the bed. There was one towel, one mug (unwashed), one spoon, coffee, tea and no sugar in the room. We were unable to unpack or hang our clothes so spent the night getting ready stepping over our cases. The kettle would not fit under the tap so we could only fill it by scooping water from the dirty mug. The kettle then could only be plugged in on a plug half way up the wall and the kettle had to be held whilst being boiled. We went to Reception and asked to change room and was advised that nothing was available. We asked for the bed to be remade with a double sheet as we did not wish to lay on an exposed mattress, we were told there was nothing wrong with the bed and the sheets were changed only once per stay – after a lot of arguing we finally got a sheet and made the bed ourselves. We asked for an extra towel and again was told we could not have one, the towels were only given out once per stay, we tried explaining it was not reasonable to expect us both to use the same towel and after much arguing finally we got an extra towel, the same went for the mug. The receptionist was extremely rude and unhelpful and made it very hard for us to get these extra items, we asked to speak to a manager but was advised one would not be available until Monday am. When we returned to the room a few minutes later the receptionist burst into the room without knocking and said; ‘sorry sirs you are right the room is terrible, I will get you a refund, the fu~~ing cleaner did not do his job properly, tomorrow I will F~~k him F~~k him..... we were completely shocked by this outburst. The receptionist continually apologised agreeing the room was disgusting and said that tomorrow (Sunday) he would get us a better room and a refund for Saturday, he had also brought with him an open plate of sugar which contained dirty bits. We had an unpleasant nights sleep in what was a dirty cold room and showered in a disgusting mouldy shower. We could only sit on the toilet sideways as our legs would not fit in front of us. That night we returned to the hotel at separate times. My partner came in and went to bed taking the key from reception (we had to leave the key at the desk when going out). I returned at 4am and after knocking continually at the Reception window the receptionist got out his bed which was made on the reception floor and advised me I could not have a key to get in but I must wake up my partner to get in my room– which I therefore did. The following morning we chose not to have breakfast at the hotel as we did not feel satisfied that the food hygiene would be up to standards as the room certainly as not. We spoke to the same receptionist in the morning and again he apologised and said we must speak with the manager on Monday morning (Mr S...?) and he would arrange a refund for us. In the meantime he had said that he had arranged for us to return to our original hotel to a larger room with a wardrobe so we could hang our clothes – all was to be in order and waiting for us. We walked back to the Corbigoe with our luggage and was told by the receptionist that we had to pay £15 extra for the room! By this time I was really annoyed and made it clear i would not be paying anymore. We were then taken to a room on the 3rd floor – room 13. This room was larger with a wardrobe and contained 3-beds. The room was still dirty and the beds made with just a single sheet on the mattress, it was again a disgusting room , however we could hang our clothes. The beds that night were extremely uncomfortable and the towel rail fell off the wall, the Tv only had 4 working channels. During our stay I noted that every fire door was propped open and I advised the receptionist that this was not correct as the fire doors should remain closed to prevent the spread of fire, the receptionist would not accept this and said they were left open to let people in/out. This therefore gave us grave concern as we were up on the 4th floor and our only means of escape in the event of a fire was down the one set of stairs where all the doors were constantly propped open! I also noticed that some fire extinguishers required a re-service this month. That night I returned to the hotel before my partner (who had the key on him) and asked the receptionist for a spare key, he told me ‘no’ and that i had to get the key from my partner. Not being happy I insisted he opened the door with a master key to let me in, finally he gave me a key but said I must return it immediately after unlocking my door, I said NO as I did not wish to walk up/down 4 flights of steep stairs, and reluctantly he followed me up to take back the key. Again we chose not to take breakfast at the hotel. I explained to the receptionist that i wished to have a written confirmation of my complaints which he refused to give. He said i must speak with the manager but the manager was away on holiday. I have photos which I can send you showing all the above mentioned faults should you wish. I am an operations Manager for a Warner hotel so I did realise that @£50 per night we would be not be getting large rooms or anything special in London – we just wanted a clean place to sleep, shower and take breakfast;, however we did expect a clean room and bed, towels, blankets and sheets and to stay in the hotel we had booked and not get treated rudely. We did not get what we paid for and in fact one night did not even get to stay in the hotel we booked for. The whole experience ruined our weekend as we felt uncomfortable walking and washing in dirty rooms, stepping over our cases because we could not hang anything. We tried to speak to a manager and was refused 3-times.

Reviews.Title: “SLEEP IN THE GUTTER,ITS CLEANER”
Reviews.Author: darren m
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel for 3 nights,its situated in a nice area but when we got to the hotel we were shocked,then when we got in our room we were even more shocked,the rooms were smelly,no towels in the roon,the bed was very uncomfortable the wardrobe looked ancient and was falling to pieces.The bathroom was also dirty,the shower looked 50 years old because the showerhead was rusty,then the next morning all you got for breakfast was cerial and toast,it was D.I.Y.as you were queueing up to use a toaster,you didn't even get a cooked breakfast'so we went to the cafes for our breakfast.When we left this place we were glad.I wouldn't stay here again.ALSO THIS PLACE NEEDS CLOSING BY HEALTH AND SAFETY.I ADVISE ANYONE DONT STAY HERE ITS DISCUSTING.

Reviews.Title: “SHUT IT DOWN!”
Reviews.Author: lianne6520
Reviews.Content: Although a late review, I came across more bad reviews and thought I would add to it. My teenage daughter and I spent one night here, and it was just abyssmal. Staff were awful, and yes, looked dirty and unkempt. Was charged twice for the room. Had one towel between us, TV hanging off the bracket, no signal.What else, nails sticking out of the wardrobe door, black stains in the shower, No lock on the room door. Dirty linen. Best thing about this poor excuse of a hotel? THE EXIT!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is unsafe”
Reviews.Author: Ramunas P
Reviews.Content: While we were out, a burglar (presumably a staff member) took the room key from the reception, broke into our room and stole a mobile phone left for charging.

Reviews.Title: “not quite as bad as some reviews say.”
Reviews.Author: Sheena06
Reviews.Content: On arriving here we were taken to room 2 downstairs, this is a quad room, room was quite big, with 2 double beds and an en-suite. clean except the carpets. clean bedding, although the throw could have done with a wash. I always check beds in any hotel, I stay. Especially as bedbugs are becoming more and more common in London. I checked 1st bed, some signs maybe I thought. Checked other bed and sure enough I found an adult bedbug, running around on the sheets. My husband went up and brought the manager down to have a look. He apoligised and moved us, no problem, to room 10 which wasn't too bad, 1 double bed, 1 single. Again the throw could have done with a wash, however the sheets were clean. As we had to wait whilst room service put on clean bedding and hoovered and tidied room etc. I refused to take my cases into this room until I had checked out the whole room for bedbugs. The manager was more than happy to allow me to do this. I checked everywhere for signs of bugs even along the skirting, by lifting up carpets. NO BUGS.. I found the staff really friendly and helpful. On a night time there was a smell of curry as you came in the door,the staff were having their tea's etc. They do have to eat sometimes. However this didn't linger, as staff sprayed room freshener after they had finished eating. We took our own towels, so can't comment on that. I made our beds everyday before leaving room. House keeping went into our room everyday to mop bathroom floor and give a quick hoover. The room always smelt fresh when we returned, bathroom bin was always emptied, daily. Due to some reviews on here, we took our own toilet rolls, but never had to use them as staff renewed them daily. The shower pressure wasn't very good and the way the showers are the water often went on the floor towards toilet. Apart from this we had a really pleasant stay. We had a tight budget, so we got what we paid for. If people want the Hilton , then pay for the hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in a hostel, it would be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: kings100524
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read the reviews before I had booked this hotel. The room was disgusting. The sheets were stained and looked like they hadn't been washed in months. During are four day stay, not once did they vacuum or change the sheets. The walls are so thin, that we could actually hear the whole conversation of the people next door. The dresser was falling apart and the the door fell off drawer when we tried to open it. They have a very strict towel policy and only allow one towel per person every other day. When we asked for more we were scolded and told no extra towels. Stay at another hotel, you may have to pay more but the extra $10-20 will be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: sparkle132
Reviews.Content: If you stay here you will get bed bugs, you wont sleep because its so smelly and the sheets havent been cleaned. They smell of curry/body odour. And you'll feel so dirty you'll then try and have a shower and come out feeling worse because the bathroom is filthy. I didnt realise hotels like this existed. This hotel should be closed down for health and safety reasons You are better off sleeping in your car..or in victoria station as a previous reviewer suggested!! And dont even try complaining as they will look at you blankly and pretend not to understand

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Dump”
Reviews.Author: CobaltKaige
Reviews.Content: It's inexpensive for a reason. The beds are quite uncomfortable, the furniture is falling apart, the walls are dirty, the fan in the bathroom is useless, there aren't even towels in the rooms (you have to get them from the front desk).... It's just not a place I'd recommend for anyone other than maybe lads out on a stag weekend who would feel just as comfortable sleeping in their own sick. The staff were nice, though only marginally helpful when there's a reservation problem or the like. We booked a few months ago, but they had sustained water damage in some rooms due to heavy rains. Trying to get this sorted out took way too long and they didn't really offer any compensation in the form of a discount or the like. They offered free breakfasts for us, but this only costs GBP 3 or so or so. Big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not horrible, but not good either”
Reviews.Author: oranzkyly
Reviews.Content: Good: Nice welcome, very lovely and helpful staff, quite a spacy room, ensuite as promised, clean and fresh bedding. Very convenient location. Bad: No towels (we had our own anyway), extra thin walls (you can literally hear any word), squeaky floors and stairs, broken cupboard (just ugly, but usable), breakfast is just a joke, no wifi. We stayed for 5 nights. Will probably not go there again, but it was not as horrible as the reviews have stated before.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't think a hotel could be this bad”
Reviews.Author: hopkj142
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now a joke between me and my husband....we couldn't possibly ever stay anywhere again as bad as the Corbigoe. It's bargain priced for a reason. Walls are paper thin, no shower curtain, dirty carpets....well dirty everywhere. Just avoid this hotel no matter what you do. You would be better off staying in a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Not very good.”
Reviews.Author: Doctor_Pressure
Reviews.Content: If this "hotel" were to rebrand itself as a hostel and decimate its prices, it might garner some positive reviews, but as it is, what one gets for one's money is not good. My friend arrived a while before me and our rooms were not ready, so the Corbigoe packed us off up the road to its sister hotel, the Park (no better). We returned to the Corbigoe the following night. I did not have the triple room I had booked; it was a double, and very small at that. The bed was shoved right up against the wall along with the wardrobe, which was such a flimsy piece of furniture that it almost fell over when leaned against. The room photographs on the hotel's website were misleading. The hotel charges a £3 fee for paying by card, and an amount for storing baggage. I recall the toilet having no paper, and breakfast was just cereal and bread or toast - almost no variety. We heard a gentleman having an argument with the chap on the reception desk, which went something like this: "This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in!" "Go somewhere else, then." "I demand a refund!" "We don't give refunds." The Victoria/Pimlico location is good, but that is about the only praise I can give this place. I was not that bothered about it - I have stayed in worse accommodation - but felt compelled to write this because I do not see how the owners can market it as a good hotel. If staying in the area, there are plenty of other hotels along the road from which to choose (but not the Park). They might be more expensive, but probably worth something for what you pay. This establishment is not.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: gb2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two night and it was a horrible experience. The rooms are tiny, the blankets were dirty and smelled terrible and there are no telephones in the room. Front desk charged us to call a taxi. They also charge an additional fee for toilet paper and towels. No elevators. Terrible service. Do not stay at this hotel, you will regret it.

Reviews.Title: “If you have a choice...just dont go here..”
Reviews.Author: Pieno
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Corbigoe this weekend (4/5 december) and we can say we will never forget our stay. We had a room on the third floor (no lift). Fortunately we booked a three person room...the two persoon rooms were VERY small. The bathroom was "ensuite" but with a very high threshold. It was clean..we must say. The rest of the room wasnt. The curtains were stained...empty sigaretpackage on the floor...not matching and dirty beds. I was very concerned for my safety....when a fire breaks out you are screwed on the top floors. Further more we had to pay 3% extra for using a creditcard! We had to ask for towels and got two very small towels. Nothing for the floor...so after a shower everything was wet. No phone in the room...doors crumbled from bad maintenance, our clset had no handles so no way to open them..it was hold together by screws and pieces of cardboard. We already payed..but would we have known..we would not have stayed. This "thing" should not be allowed to be called a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Owners need locking up !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DrinksmanNorwich
Reviews.Content: This must be the worst place I have ever been to. Took my card before I even saw my room and had the nerve to charge me for using my card ? I was given room 15 right on the top floor.On the way up I had to step over empty boxs, old towles and filthy rags and work mans tools. I made it to the room (15.30) the smell was unique to the place but one of bad cleaning and urine which had been liberally sprayed around the one door sized wardroom passing for the en suite.The floor carpets were stained and had not been cleaned for years. I returned to the reception and told the 2 guys at reception that they should be ashamed of themseleves and demanded my money back which was refused SHOCKING ! Please please do not go life is to short to spend even 5 mins in abject filth.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Riad S
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately as I had to spend a night in London at very short notice I didn't have time to spend looking for a hotel. And even more unfortunately I ended up booking this dump. I booked it as I needed to be near Victoria Station, and on the long walk from the station to the hotel there were lots of other hotels that looked ok so I expected the Corbigoe would be of at least a basic acceptable standard. They charged £90 for the room, adding £3 for payment by debit card - what a rip off. The hotel is really horrible, a succession of creepy men on reception who don't ask for any ID when you come in and ask for your room key. The lock on the bedroom door didn't work properly either and as a single woman I felt a bit uneasy about that. The TV didn't work properly, you couldn't get BBC1 at all, plus it was the smallest TV I have ever seen. The electrical sockets didn't work so I couldn't charge my phone. The beds were very uncomfortable and didn't look clean. I was handed a towel at reception, and there was only a small bar of soap in the room - no shampoo, no hairdryers and hardly any storage space. I couldn't use the kettle as the sockets were faulty but the mugs didn't look too clean and the tea bags looked like they had been lying around for ever. There was a very high step up to the bathroom which didn't look too clean either. This is a very overpriced, rundown dump which should be closed down. I will never again book a hotel without first checking out it's reviews - big mistake. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AVOID AVOID PLEASE PLEASE READ!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lauren_mc84
Reviews.Content: Please read my review, i read other reviews on this hotel but decided to ignore them make up my own opinion on this!! I WISH I HAD LISTENED TO PREVIOUS GUESTS!!! i am like any others thought everyone always has some complaint about everything and that the hotel couldnt be that bad.........how wrong i was, if you never take any other advise PLEASE take this......AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!!!! Upon arriving at the Park Hotel London myself female (25) and my mother (50) were greeted with silence from the gent behind the counter, he placed his hand out and simply said 'confirmation form' and then 'how are you paying', we thought nothing of this other than he must have been having a bad day, however he was quick enough to demand payment!! He then said there was a problem with our room and that we would be moved "half a minutes walk" to their other hotel. We questioned why we could not move to another room to which he said simply - we couldnt we needed to be moved. We followed the gent to the complete other end of Belgrave Road, a good 7 or 8 minutes walk from where we orginally booked! Once there at the Corbigoe Hotel, we were once again greeted with silence! We were then shown to our room, three doors down from the reception area, we opened the door and i had to stand outside the room while the gent showed my mum inside as it wasnt big enough for 3 of us!! We had paid for a private bathroom and toilet. We asked where this was to which he said your bathrooms here - to our amazment the private bathroom was a cupboard with a shower head. We asked again where our toilet was to which he said it is 2 doors down next to the reception!! We complained that we had paid extra for private toilet, to which his reply was "well only you will be using this"! We then asked the gent where we should go for breakfast as we had paid for this to which he said you have not paid for breakfast at this hotel, we once again complained perfusly that we had not only had to move hotel but now we had to argue for something we had already paid for, i asked the man to get my confirmation form out which stated this and he refused to do so, i then said i have it here on my phone in email format stating clearly we have paid for breakfast, he response to this was "well we will see in the morning"! We were then woke up at 7.45am by builders in the next room, drilling, sawing and banging! We got up at this point totally disgusted and left at 8.30! To say the least this experience completely ruined our trip, (which was to celebrate my mums 50th by seeing a show and shopping). The attitude of both staff from each hotel was something i have never experienced before and wouldnt wish anyone to experience this again. The room was dirty, the heating not working, the television above the bed looked totally unsafe, the one cup for tea was cracked and broken. I feel extremely saddend that a company like this can still trade, i feel the authorities should be informed and i will be taking this matter further.

Reviews.Title: “What a horrible place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: friedchicken030
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend were looking for a nice and cheap place to stay while visiting London. We had never been there and the location seemed to be quite good. After a long bus ride we finally reached the Victoria station and started looking for the hotel. It actually took us quite a while as the map given on their website was a little misleading, so we had to ask help from several other hotels nearby. Finally we found it. As we got there we were given some papers to fill in. After that we were told that we will be staying in another building so we had to carry our luggage to there. As we got to this place, we were taken downstairs to a very nasty room, which door actually had a sign saying Fire exit on it. It had one big bed, on top of it was an ugly looking towel and a used soap. It was just horrible. It didnt take us long to decide that we were so not going to stay there! So we went back upstairs where we were told to pay for a one night stay:S:S so we just did it in order to get away from there as soon as possible!!! So there we were alone in the big city without any accommodation. Luckily we had looked up another place to stay at and they had a mixed dorm which was compared to Corbigoe really nice. Sooo I can only advise you to stay away from this hotel. Before actually booking, we looked at this site and read the negative comments but we coulndt believe it would be actually so bad. So please do not make the mistake and pay a couple of more pounds and find a better place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “awful place”
Reviews.Author: louis186356
Reviews.Content: we have just arrived back from this hotel and never again would i stay there .on walking in the man on the counter said i have given you a room with bunkbeds for the children . the bunk beds were falling to bits there was no guard on the top bunk so my son could of rolled out onto the floor we ended up putting the matress on the floor when it was bedtime also the ladder was hanging off. ther was a lamp above the bunks intended for the chidren this was also broken and wires hanging out. the floor was absolutely filthy stains on the walls and skirting boards. ther was a kettle provided on one side of the room but no plug socket to plug it in so was pointless the only plug socket available was the tv socket which was high up on the wall so the kettle lead wouldnt of reached . i was very disgusted into how this hotel can pass basic regulations and health and safety checks .the only good side to the trip was we were out of the room 10 hrs a day and didnt have to spend anytime in the room . glad we never paid for breakfast thats all i can say!

Reviews.Title: “Horrific is being kind”
Reviews.Author: bbabi916
Reviews.Content: First time traveler to London, my sister and I booked our stay at the Corbigoe Hotel. The man had us fill in our registration form and requested our passports and then said we had to go to a different part of his hotel just a few short blocks away. As we walked through the streets of London with our luggage we were perplexed as we passed other hotels and kept asking if we were going to be in their hotel. After walking about 3 blocks we got to 'their' hotel and were told our room was 3 flights up and we carried our luggage up the 3 long flights. The room had one bed for myself and my sister...the curtains were falling off the window.. there was no draw space and the bathroom smelled of filth. We went down to the front desk clerk to complain of the conditions and noticed there was another name - The Park Hotel and we asked if this was part of the Corbigoe and he curtly said that it was not. The conditions infuriated us but knowing that we were not at the hotel we booked ourselves at made the matter even worse. We wanted to file a complaint and the front desk clerk told us to go back to the other hotel because we were registered there and it was not his concern. We said we were not going back to that hotel being we were informed that they were both the same establishment, even though at this point we know that this was not the truth. We requested that the man get our luggage and he nastily told us that he was a 2 star hotel, a bed and breakfast and had a job to do and was not going to get our luggage. We were not going to stay at a hotel that we did not make reservations at. The man finally sent one of the staff up to our room to retrieve our luggage. We were forced to walk around London until we found a much higher priced hotel where we could stay. If you ever go to London DO NOT ever go to the Corbigue or the Park Hotel, the staff is unwelcoming, the service is lousy, and the rooms are disgusting. I would choose sleeping in a train station over the Corbigue Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My experince with Corbigoe is a nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: wistful639
Reviews.Content: We knew accommodation in London was expensive so we asked our travel agent to book us into a budget hotel. They booked us into Corbigoe in London. The tariff was cheap at UK Pounds 99 per night for 4 people in an ensuite room. Our travel agent could not get us two ensuite rooms during the period we were in London (i.e. six nights). We did not expect our accommodation to be grand, just reasonable. However we did not expect it to be a nightmare and that was our experience with Corbigoe. The room given to us was filthy. The bed I slept in seemed to be the base of an old ensemble which springs poking at my back so I woke up every morning whilst there with sore back. Not only that but the bed was infested with bugs. My roommate had bad rashes in her eyes, earlobes, arms, legs, etc. The towels were not available when we arrived at the hotel and were not even changed after 2 days. The bedsheets seemed to have been the ones used by previous guests. Pillows stank. The small bin provided was not emptied daily. The toilet was difficult to flash. All together it was a very horrible experience. I have stayed in budget accommodation but not as worse as this. This was really appalling. Corbigoe should improve the condition of their rooms, just keep them clean and free from infestation.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID CORBIGOE HOTEL – THE WORST HOTEL IN LONDON”
Reviews.Author: kanga1245
Reviews.Content: We booked and prepaid for 6 nights stay and the place was hell, it really was appalling, the room looked and it was dirty. No bath towels when we arrived, didn't provide hand towel. The bedsheets weren’t changed from the last guests who used them before us, the pillow stank. The bedsheets were changed after 3 days and the towels were changed after 4 days which should be every 2 days as we were told. The rubbish bin wasn’t even cleared till the 3rd day. The room including the bathroom were vacuumed and cleaned on the 3rd day. The worst part and it really made me cry was there were bedbugs which I found crawling on the side of the bedsheet on the first morning of our stay and again the following morning. I had rashes and bites all over me – eyes, earlobes, arms, legs, thighs on our 2nd day there up until the last day of my stay. I mentioned this to the guy at reception but there was no response. Breakfast was basic, I won’t complain, what do expect from the B&B budget accommodation. This is the worst Hotel in London, same comment from other people in the area. The hotel doesn’t even deserve a rating of “1 star”. I definitely will never ever recommend Corbigoe hotel to anybody. Please be warned, this is not the hotel to stay in London even if it is convenient and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY THERE!”
Reviews.Author: dr_vol_17
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my friend and we booked basic room in this "hotel" for 2 nights. When we arrived they moved us to Park hotel (is owned the same people) and they gave us THE MOST DISGUSTING ROOM which I ever seen!!!! It was in the basement and it looked like a SHED with NO WINDOW, horrible bad and filthy walls!! We didnt want to stay there any seconds and we wanted changed our room ..and the staff told me that THIS WAS BASIC ROOM that it was normal standard and they were suprised that we didnt want to stay there!!! Can you believe that???? We wanted them to give us back our money but they gave us back just half ...so they made a profit on us!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Pagey54
Reviews.Content: My daughter was in London with work and originally booked in at the sister hotel The Park hotel (owned by the same people who own The Corbigoe and just as badly rated). However when given the room in a basement was disgusted at what she saw. So agreed to the offer of a move to the Corbigoe. It was just as bad and in line with other reports. Had to stop one night so slept on top of the bed fully clothed. Was sickened to find bugs crawling around on the bed in the morning. Apreciate may be a budget hotel but no excuse for this and should be closed down by the authorities and trading standards. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, filthy, Pit!!”
Reviews.Author: serina29
Reviews.Content: Arrived late, and had no reservation so no choice but to stay in what I can only describe as the most rancid, dirty, stink pit I've ever seen, let alone had the misfortune to stay in! Area surrounding the hotel is very dangerous to, lot's of police and crime!

Reviews.Title: “Awful, retched place. A hole not a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SamRae05
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel, were told there were no rooms and taken across the road about 60yards to a "sister" hotel. We were given a room at the very top of the hotel. This room housed a double bed, en-suite and NO room to move. The bedding looked unclean and the hotel stank! We had booked a twin room and were offered this room for 1 night and promised a twin room the next night. We caused a commotion and EVENTUALLY were told we would get our money back after calling customer services at lastminute.com I would not recommend this hotel. I would not say I am fussy, but I would never have slept in that room!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: mverivaki
Reviews.Content: I had read the worst reviews one could possibly write about any hotel, so I was pleasantly surprised that our room (no. 2) was warm, the bathroom was brand new and large enough for two normal-sized people to fit in (if you are obese, you will stay have space on your own there), and the breakfast was warm and filling. Even the tv worked, so my children could watch cartoons in the mornings. The room had obviously been refurbished because the windows were aluminium. The staff (all Indians) was extremely pleasant and helpful. The hotel was located in a quiet area near the underground, but our room was next to the central heating motor, which made it a little uncomfortable at night. The owner even got up at 5am to wake us up on our departure day so that we wouldn't miss our taxi ride to the airport. This is a no-frills hotel with high value for money. I'd definitely stay here again if I needed to stay in the centre of London.

Reviews.Title: “A filthy disgusting excuse for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: scarlet85 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked into this hotel for an October break in London for myself & my 2 kids and after being there half an hour knew I had made a mistake. The room was tiny for 3, the furniture was shabby with handles and doors missing,one of the beds had no bedding and after asking 3 times for bedding and extra blankets as there was no heating still didn't get any.The bathroom was filthy and our room window on the 3rd floor opened without a balcony and a ledge with a sheer 40/50ft drop,there was no safety catch on the window considering this was a family room .I had booked for 4 nights and checked out after 2 and am still trying to get my money back. I don't know how this so called hotel is still in business.

Reviews.Title: “We got some money back :)”
Reviews.Author: signes
Reviews.Content: We stayed (me and my friends (3 of them)) there in Oct 2009. 2 nights.' I booked 2 rooms, but we get 1. So we had 4 person in the same room. I think they was just overbooked. Later I discuss that with my travel agent, and she did some complaints and we got almoust -50% discount. The bathroom was strange. There wasent any normal door. The breakfast was basic - tea, coffee, whitebread, butter. The location is really perfekt. The beds and sheets, towels were clean,but the carpet was really old. The TV was small, but ok! The cups were a bit dirty. Any way we had really good time in LONDON. And it was just place where we had a nap. nb! I dint saw any insects. So then it was just ok!

Reviews.Title: “Slept in my clothes..”
Reviews.Author: caznbri
Reviews.Content: Couldnt believe this hotel popped up on the news but in another way I can! was unfortunate enough to spend one night here few years ago utterly spine chillingly horrid - sheets so threadbear and disguisting I kept my t shirt and jeans on and slept in them..even the bedroom walls had holes in them which were stuffed with TISSUES... the mind boggles! Smell hit you as soon as you walked thru the door, of damp rotting..curry? veg? who knows. YUCK!

Reviews.Title: “They moved me to other place, but there was a sign written "vacancies"”
Reviews.Author: cinoto
Reviews.Content: I don´t know if the hotel is really nice because I booked it more than one month before my vacation and when I arrived they moved me to another hotel in the same street. The most interesting thing was that there was a sign in the door when I arrived written: "vacancies". The other one (Park hotel) was terrible, noisy and cold, I don´t know if they moved me because the Corbigoe Hotel was better or worse...

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: LLacro
Reviews.Content: We were moved to another hotel (Park Hotel), without explanation. Location is very good. Our room was very small, but it had everything we needed. A bed, tv, toilet and a shower. We didn't receive new towels. However, the room was cleaned every day. We were prepared for the worst, and to our relief the hotel wasn't as bad as we expected.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Lotus405 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The room smelled like smelly mens feet and everything about the room was dirty and grotty.At night the room was freezing cold and the spare blankets smelled so bad I resorted to sleeping in my clothes.. scarf and hat included. When showering as there was no fan in the ensuite ( where mould grew on the ceiling and walls and pieces were falling from the shabby ceiling tiles), the fire alarm went off...following which the guy from reception pounded on the door. Walking the streets all night would have been a better experience. NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, horrible, horrible...I even left and stayed at another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lmsal
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at the Corbigoe as it was cheap and in a nice area. When I arrived the atmosphere was not very welcoming and we went up to our room and it wasn't even clean from the previous guests!! We complained and left to stay at the guest house on the opposite side of the road.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrible Experience!”
Reviews.Author: michaellap1994
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a shame that is worse than the shelter! Once I got into the room, everything was terrible. First of all, the pillows were terribly dirty and they just used a blanket to cover it (they wouldn't change the blanket till you checked out) . Besides, the television was very small in and it was impossible to watch BBC One since I believed the signal was interfered. Also, I can tell you the most terrible thing that caused my mum sick was the toilet had never been cleaned and the towel had never been changed as well. I really couldn't believe it because cleaning the toilet and changing the towel are really important in a hotel as we take a bath or shower everyday. Since they call themselves as a hotel, I believed the breakfast would be a traditional English breakfast, however, the breakfast was just a few pieces of bread, coffee and tea, which was kept in an old tin. Furthermore, the 'hotel' was far away from the Victoria station as I spent about 15 minutes to walk to the hotel from the station and I found that the nearest station is Pimlico station, which took me a few minutes to walk to there. Finally, please do not trust the information from their own website because I was cheated by their description! Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Should be Shut Down by London Tourist Board!”
Reviews.Author: Doublemsf
Reviews.Content: What a Nightmare! This place is disgusting and should be shut down by the London Tourist Board. Mattresses had stains all over and springs were popping through. When we complained the manager suggested we stack the mattresses. Mold in the bathroom and none of the electrical outlets worked. Bathroom had a dangerously high step up and the door did not close in the opening. The toilet paper holder and toilet seat were broken and everything was filthy. The single closet was falling apart and almost fell over when we opened the door. The room was filthy and carpets were disgusting with the blanket being much the same. The windows did not shut and as we were just below the street level which compromised our security. The staff was rude and uncompromising and the continental breakfast which we did not eat was still left out unprotected by the end of the day when we returned to collect our bags to move to another hotel. Don't let anything convince you to stay at this Dive. It’s just not worth it and is guaranteed to ruin your London trip which it would have done for us had we not left after one sleepless night.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: judged77
Reviews.Content: We had read reviews just before our trip, that this is a hellhole. So our expectations were very low, and we had desided to check the first night and change if it really is that bad. We had a 6,5 months years old baby with us. For the price and location, this was very good hotel. Of course, there very flaws, only one towel (we asked the next day and got 2 more), the heating was on only by night, but that was when it was needed so no problem. No real blanket, but the system of sheet and dayblanket was good enough, and I think that was how it was mentioned to be. The biggest flaw was the shower. We were it topfloor, and waterpressure was, well,non-existent at that altitude. So showering was a bit hard. For budget traveller, this was very good. Shops and restaurants nearby, 100 meters on Pimlico Underground, about 1 km to Victoria. And the inner city sightseeings in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: stitchedup20
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay here for my birthday. My first time staying in London. The room we got was right next to reception. Very noisy. The bathroom needed a ladder to get in to it, if you dared go in. Mould was growing everywhere. No towels were provided and when we asked were told they were out of clean ones. We bought our own in markets. At least we knew they were clean. The window was held in with screws. The noise from reception was terrible. The staff were rude. We didn't stay for breakfast any morning. Didn't want to chance it. Would rather sleep on streets than stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never write reviews, but...”
Reviews.Author: Paja12
Reviews.Content: Very dirty, "newly refurnished" in early 60ties (see the 1970 warranty in the reception of being a member in some hotel group) and necessary repairs in the way like: damaged case-door hinge repaired that the door is screwed to the shelf and you can not open it. Sharp rest of off-knocked soap holder in the shower, faded and ragged drapery on bed, moulded corners in shower basin, plugged washing basin, shower etc. I realised they do no vacuum cleaning during your stay - only think they do is that they "somehow" make your bed and desinficise WC. During my stay the heating was off, I experienced very cold nights, especially beware - there are no quilts, only a linen and bed spreads (not well thermo-isolating, dirty, of course). You are strictly asked to check out already at 10:30, however when I arrived just before 13:00, the "large" (as the receptionist said) room was not made yet. It was a double room those size and equipment I would compare to a prison cell (2,5x 4 m including bathroom), no table, no chair. The second day when I returned, the room door stayed opened, however I locked it in the morning. And what more - the receptionist gave me another key - so I also could enter another room. Also interesting was the fact, that leaving luggage in the hotel (I do not write in reception, on purpose) is charged 1 GPB per piece (I have never seen such charges, it was always free). In fact the luggage was in the breakfast room where other guests could enter. Really terrible experience, I would not believe that for two nights you can after monday night reduction pay 99 GBP.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a shocker”
Reviews.Author: silverthistle
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Corbigoe, around 11.00am after a 30 hour flight, really just wanting to put our heads down for a catch up sleep Wow room was not ready, asked to come back at 3.00pm left bags and walked around London . 7 flights steps no lift no help. Shown twin room, sheets clean, bathroom very shabby, shower mouldy not working, had to ask for help. Noise from TV and neighbours next door all night. A coat of paint would lift the atmosphere throughout. All the Traveller wants is clean, tidy room available on arrival, and a decent breakfast . Juice, Cornflakes, milk, make your own white bread toast, butter and jam. Coffee and Tea was provided Come on Corbigoe London smarten up your act, other B/Bs in England, Scotland, Germany and France are so far ahead with service to the traveller.

Reviews.Title: “The Corbigoe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MunichBavaria
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews about the Corbigoe hotel on this site only shortly before our stay which we had booked months ago and not being able to cancel the booking at such short notice we were prepared to face hell's teeth when we arrived at the Corbigoe, but were pleasantly surprised. We had booked a triple room and were given a room for five persons in the basement. In relation to the price (if you buy cheap you get cheap) the room was clean and OK. It is true that the breakfast (tea/coffee, toast and jam) is nothing to write home about but that is not the most important thing in a hotel, is it? The staff were very kind and helpful and all in all we had a pleasant stay at that hotel. The Victoria line gave great access to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “NO WAY”
Reviews.Author: dinokonstk
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in Corbigoe in a Barbie-room. We were given a tiny room that hardly fitted the double bed and the cupboard. Shower was like in a cupboard. Imagine: we were 2 people and had to take turns as only 1 person could be standing in the "room". Bathroom was outside the room! Very disappointing experience. Spoiled our first day in London.

Reviews.Title: “most horrible place”
Reviews.Author: ali137
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at this hotel for a 2 night stay, originally we were meant to stay at the park hotel the man on reception said he would take us to another hotel just down the road with better rooms as we got kids. upon checking in the first turn off was we were on the second storey up 4 flights of stairs. the room had a double bed and a bunk its smelled really bad outside the room inside was small the bathroon was dirty and grimey and smelled, the beds were hard and had vile bed linens on the windows were dirty we kept expecting something to crawl out from under the bed it was the worst 2 nights of our lives my kids were miserable they promised cable tv/internet where was that we had 2 channels, the kitchen was vile we did not eat there we bought flip flops just so we could have a shower and towels and bedding to sleep on it was a cesspool not fit for human inhabitants and thars putting it mildly i wouldnt put a animal there nevermind people.....if this was a better hotel i'd hate to see the park. Please fellow travellers check trip advisors before booking a hotels i'm afraid i didnt and this resulted in the worst experience for me and my family.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: travrelling
Reviews.Content: We were 8 adults from Denmark staying there for 4 nights. We had booked 4 dbl. rooms 6 months in advance, but on the day of arrival we were put into a 4 bed room, two 3 bed rooms and a doubble room. We were asked to change rooms for the next day and then back again the following day. The rooms (floor, shelves) were dirty and in the bathroom there were mould fungis all over. Breakfast was, if you like toast and jam, all right, but no good service at all. Don't expect to get new or dry towels when needed. Sorry to say, but the worst hotel we have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Hell Hole”
Reviews.Author: pingirl
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune to stay in. It was a last minute booking so we didn't have time to check it out first. It's hard knowing where to start but I think the most shocking thing for me was the boarded up fire exit which I'm sure can't be legal or in any way in line with health and safety regulations. Also, I remember the stair carpet not lying correctly so you could easily trip and fall down the stairs. We were given a twin room and both of the beds had sheets and pillows that had stains not just on one side but on both sides and at both ends of the beds suggesting that they had turned the sheets over several times rather than washing them. I was just glad we were only staying for 1 night and couldn't wait to go out and come back drunk so that I wouldn't care so much about the appauling room. We weren't brave enough to stay for breakfast. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL - IT NEEDS TO BE SHUT DOWN! It truly is a health and saftey risk and so please don't risk it - just read the previous reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Better than other reviews say”
Reviews.Author: alexk478
Reviews.Content: I was originally booked into the Park hotel (same owners and same road) but was told on check in that the bed was 'a little bit broken' and so I was taken down the road and checked in at the Corbigoe. Having read reviews for the Park I was surprised that my room, although small was clean and comfortable. The en suite was small admittedly but perfectly adequate, and looked as if it had been retiled fairly recently. The room I ended up in was actually a triple (double + single beds) so was plenty big enough for a lone traveller. It was on the 4th floor, which is a lot of steps but they can't exactly make the floors closer together. The tv worked fine, although it hadn't been tuned properly (soon fixed). Its on quite a busy road but with the windows closed it was fine. My only particular gripe was that there was no milk for the tea and coffee in the room. This place i fine if you need somewhere to stay for a couple of nights while in London (either sight seeing or for work) but not a luxuary place for a special trip but you can't expect that for £30 a night in central London.

Reviews.Title: “go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: davepo
Reviews.Content: scary..very dirty..smells..do not do it..very nice people though!

Reviews.Title: “do not use this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ddickinscoll
Reviews.Content: please do not use this hotel. It was horrible. The bed was clean and comfortable, the room was warm and the breakfast coffee was ok but everything else was awful. Everything was shabby dirty creaky. The cleaner I dont think had ever cleaned the windows in our room as, when I rubbed the condensation away cos it was raining, dirt ran down the window. We were just leaving then thank goodness. The window frame was filthy, the bathroom sink was awful and the loo needed a gallon of bleach down it. . The only reason we stayed (2 nights) was because we had never intended spending any time there apart from sleeping and thought we could put up with it. The shower was the worst thing. I could not bear to use it. The shower tray was held in place with so much sealant you would not believe and where there was no sealant there was black mould. Breakfast I suppose was ok if you like cornflakes, rice crispies and plastic white toast and jam. (As much as you want though I have to say) I often think that when you are out and about on a city break, the hotel doesnt matter much as all you do is sleep and wash in it. But next time I will trade up..no doubt about it. There were mostly foreign guest there, Italian, Spanish etc. I was ashamed because we have stayed in cheap hotels in lots of European cities and all bar none have been great.

Reviews.Title: “Forgot for it”
Reviews.Author: Sallwa26
Reviews.Content: Save Your money for another hotel. Belgrave Road is full of small hotels which are better than Corbigoe Hotel. They lost our reservation which was before confirmed by theyr sales manager. All negativ comments on Tripadvisor are TRUE. Tomas

Reviews.Title: “Worse Nightmare - Carbigoe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: twaforever
Reviews.Content: Carbigoe Hotel, 101 Belgrave Road , London. When we arrived at this hotel and saw the accommodations, we were absolutely shocked! First we had to climb 87 (!) steps to get to our room! Then the room was tiny, smelly, the lock on door was broken, bathroom was absolutely disgusting, sheets were stained, mold everywhere. We immediately checked out, but the hotel manager had the nerve to charge us two night stay! We didn't care, as there was no way we would spend even one night in this hell hole! It is horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Bobbi26
Reviews.Content: We had read some really bad reviews about this place but decided to book anyhow as it is a great price for the location in London. We were pleasantly surprised, the hotel was in a great location with two tube stops close by, the staff were very friendly too. Rooms were very small, however clean, breakfast was not fancy but ample. Would definately stay here next time we come to London.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: guinea35
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 guys went to London for 3 days and as we are students, we wanted a cheap hotel. The Corbigoe looked ok on the website and seemed a reasonable price. It is the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in. My room was very near to reception and all I could hear was the owner's mobile going off at 2 am and people going to their rooms, as the walls were paper thin. My supposed en-suite room had the toilet along the corridoor and lots of people used it which meant it was dirty. The so called continental breakfast consisted of cornflakes and toast - not a huge selection. Overall the place needed a good clean and more towels!! The only plus point was the location - very near to Pimlico station and not too far from Victoria. I would not return again, and would certainly not reccommend the corbigoe to a woman travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “a moist intriguing experience”
Reviews.Author: Sprettmais
Reviews.Content: Well, you get what you pay for- in our case a 2,5x2,5 m2 room, with a tiny tv and a foul smell. Our towels didn't dry in the four days we stayed there, the kettle was broken and there was mildew in the shower. The walls are paper thin- you hear every move your (horny in our case) neighbour does. Eat breakfast somewhere else. Seriously. Just around the corner a sweet spanish man makes you a delicious breakfast and good coffee. Use Pimlico underground station, much closer than Victoria. The toilet is in the hallway- and don't be surprised if someone left you a present- the toilet flushes poorly. But the staff is not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: theoretic
Reviews.Content: Corbigoe is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I planned a trip to London for New Year's and while looking for a budget hotel I came across the Corbigoe website. Happy to see that there was a website and that there was an online booking discount offer, I called the hotel to ask a few questions, got them answered in a relatively professional manner, and went ahead to make my reservation online. I arrived in London and took the tube to the station Corbigoe recommended on their website. Big mistake. If after reading all these reviews you still plan to book with them, take the underground to Pimlico (2 blocks away), NOT to Victoria. After a long and convoluted walk I found the hotel. I was hoping to get in the room, shower, and sleep for a few hours. My friend who was staying with me was arriving later that day. At the receptionI was told that the room wasn't ready for another 3 hours...The guy at the reception told me however that I had to pay for everything now. Not being used to paying upfront, and not having enough cash, I was dismayed but gave him my credit card. He told me that there is a three-pound surcharge for using a card, and as I realized later, an awful exchange rate. He told me I could leave my suitcase in the room and come back in a few hours. I walked into the room and was overcome by disappointment, fear, and a desire to run away! The room was tiny, untidy and dirty. I thought that they probably hadn't cleaned it yet since the previous customers checked out. I left the hotel, and returned after about 2 hours, which I thought was ample time for them to get it cleaned, since they knew I had arrived already. When I came back the room was still unavailable, but the man rushed the maid to wrap up the cleaning so that I could use the room. As a result they forgot to leave any toilet paper or soap. I took a nap and thought that after I wake up everything will seem better. After I woke up, things were even worse. There was serious mold on the walls. The carpet was still dirty (I found jelly beans on the floor). The drawers were dirty and sticky. There was a thick layer of dust on the closet. The bathroom ceiling leaked every time someone upstairs showered. One of the wall lamps had no bulb and was broken. Given that there are no phones in the rooms, I wasn't sure how they would let me know that my friend had arrived. But he had no difficulty finding the room. Apparently, he gave the receptionist my name and they told him the room # and let him in without asking any other questions (not even his name) and without letting me know that someone was here to see me. During the 6 days we stayed the room was never cleaned, the (two) towels never changed, and the bed was made once. When I checked out there were two men in the reception. I returned the key and told them I'm checking out. They said "OK". I also gave them 3 umbrellas that I had to buy for the rain, and told them that they could give them out to other customers when they need them (I needed one the first night, and was told that they didn't have any). They took them and remained silent. I stood there for a minute or so, waiting for the courtesy "thank you for staying with us" or "we hope you enjoyed your stay", but all I got were looks of "ok, you're done". At that moment all I could do was smile and be happy that I was out of there. Had I not paid in advance, and were it not a busy time of the year, I would have left from day 1. I was looking forward to writing this review to prevent others from ruining their vacation. I am not really fussy about where I stay, but at Corbigoe I was counting down the days for my vacation to be over.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: helga1
Reviews.Content: We expected a cheap hotel with low standard and that is what it was. The linen was clean, the bathroom got cleaner during our stay... but it was cold and unwelcoming. Some small changes could make it to a nice place. For example if the men/owners(?) were nicer! If there was a welcome board on the inside of the roomdoors, Telling:" welcome to carbigoe hotel. We hope you will have a pleasent stay "...so on and at last " please note our breakfast time, our checkingout time..." etc. There was one time for breakfast at the reception and one at the breakfastroomdoor. We had to ask for towels, toiletpaper etc. We didn't bother to ask for soap, we used our schampoo. otherwise it was worth the price we payed.

Reviews.Title: “Should Be Closed Down”
Reviews.Author: east15
Reviews.Content: Neve assume that London has hotels to offer if you just turn up without having made any plans. Otherwise you end up staying at the bottom of the barrell in the likes of the Corbigoe hotel! The staff have no attention to detail and just seem to be plain lazy. The place looks like it was set up 30 years ago and hasn't had a touch up since. They overbook you into their hotel and then send other customers down to their other flea pit, the the Rama. We sussed this out when speaking to two other guests. The hotel does not have rating and the experience which I had has taught me never to come to London under prepared.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE, AWFUL, DISGUSTING...(need I say more?)”
Reviews.Author: mole241285
Reviews.Content: Unusually I did not check the reviews on tripadvisor like I normally do before booking a hotel. I really wish I had now... The experience of my girlfriend and I was very much like those of so many people who have left reviews. On arrival we were told that the room they had reserved for us was not available as there was a 'problem', so they would be taking us to a nearby partner hotel - the Chester Hotel. 'Taking us' actually meant that we had to walk quite some distance down the street with a member of the reception staff, who didn't offer any assistance, even though we had quite a few bags between us. We were then met by a member of staff from the other hotel. Had I not already paid for the room through hotels.com, I would have walked away as soon as I saw it. However, I did not see there being much chance of me getting my money back so we decided to brave the room for the night. The room was very small and was probably even too dirty for cockroaches to stay there. The fridge in the room did not work, the cups for us to drink tea from were covered in a healthy layer of dirt, which was actually not such an issue given that there was no tea, milk or sugar provided in the room (I eventually discovered that this was to be found in a tray outside of reception in the basement, not that I would ever have taken the risk of consuming anything from those cups) and various wires covered the floor in front of the bathroom door as the TV was some distance from the aerial socket, meaning a trip or fall was a possible occurence. Two double beds (but only 1 towel in total!) were provided in the room for our use. This was fortunate as it allowed my girlfriend and I to choose the option with the least unidentified hairs on the pillow/under the duvet. I am sure that the carpet would have proven itself to be more than a match for Mr Dyson's greatest inventions. It was very much a place where you allowed skin to make contact with any surface at your peril! My opinion of the hotel was cemented when I visited reception at 9am to return my key and check-out. After knocking on the door marked reception twice, I was met by a man dressed only in boxer shorts who just managed to grunt a thank you as he took my key. This demonstrated the level of (un-)professional service provided by the hotel. At this time, one of the two entrances to the hotel was wide open: we were very pleased to see that security was so high on the list of priorities of the hotel management. Overall, I would never ever ever ever suggest that anyone use this hotel. Not only was it disgusting but the general level of security and safety provided by the hotel was a real concern. If you are thinking about taking a room here as it is the cheapest option in London, stop being such a spend-thrift, spend an extra £5-10 and go for one of the large budget chains such as Etap and enjoy the extra travelling time from central London, it is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel should be illegal!! i challange you to find a worse hotel in london!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When my dad and i first booked for our accomodation, we booked for the park hotel. It looked so nice and cosy on internet. On arrival we were informed that we would be staying at the corbigoe hotel instead of due to electrical faults! Also that we'd be moved to the park the next day, so we thought right, fine better than nothing, and at first the staff came across as friendly and helpful! i must have had a stressful day to think that! After checking in and mentioning that we'd booked two en-suite rooms, we got a double room each, no extra charge, how generous we thought!! ! we mentioned that we had booked 2 ensuite singles, and instead of an explanation or apology, we got a dirty look!! the tv in my room did not have a single channel that worked, the draws and wardarobe were unfit for use and had a funny musty smell, so badly that i had to wash my unworn clothes when i got home!! no ensuite facalities in the room except for a wash basin, bedsheets that smelt horrible and were stained, bed that looked threadbare, the carpet may as well not had been there! i looked forward to having in room tea and coffee facilitys, but after inspecting the cups, i wouldn't let a dying person drink out of one! the paint work needed redoing badly, carpets that looked like they hadn't been hoovered ever! scratches all over the bedside draws! the towels provided in room, was so disgusting i wouldn't dry my dog with one!! as for the rest of the hotel, all carpets were threadbare, the toilet smelt horrible, was tiny, and the door lock was about as much use as a chocolate fireguard! i tried to avoid using the toilet as much as possible, the subway toilets in westminster were like royalty-type compaired to this! the shower was so small, so dark,so dirty, i went without a shower for 3 days, i thought to myself, which would i rather do, smell or catch a disease!! the staff were inconsiderate, i had the misfortune of being in the room nearest to reception and had the pleasure of them shouting at the top of there voices at 5 in the morning! and no i didn't request a wake up call!! i looked forward to a nice breakfast and cup of tea! the tea tasted like it had been drained out the nearest sewer, the breakfast was cornflakes or toast, the cornflakes tasted like they were quite literally "so last year" one morning my dad and i sent the toast back!! we felt fortunate to be given jam to go with it! i am a lover of orange juice, there juice didn't taste of orange! so after all that we had to pay out for food on outings! the breakfast room was cold, un appealing, cramped, basic, and not to mention so uncomfortable that i would have been happier to sit on a park bench! if you want accomodation that is at least clean and provides a cup of tea, i wouldn't so much recommend this hotel for that!

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OH MY GOD - what a dump this place really is - we booked to stay in the Park Hotel and was ushered along the street to this hovel - unfortunaltely we had already paid or we would have told them where to go. We were on the top floor - window would not close all catches broken so very dangerous considering we were in a family room. The furniture was all broken/bare wires everywhere, it was called ensuite - what a cheek it was a stinking shower and toilet in what i can only call an airing cupboard. As we were only staying for one night we decided to make the best of it and went in search of a pub not to return until midnight. Considering how stinking/shabby everything looked we decided to pass on breakfast and checked out by 8.30am just to be out of there. So my advise to you is not to stay here - even on a budget you are being robbed as this place is surely a health hazard and should be closed down.

Reviews.Title: “Corbigoe Hotel then...”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTrekker
Reviews.Content: I booked into this hotel primarily because this was the cheapest I could find in London and our New Zealand dollar (at that time) would only fetch 33 English pence. My wife and I are not fussy people when it comes to accommodation and with some foresight had an idea of what we may be getting ourselves into. We booked and stayed for 5 nights and although breakfast was included we did not eat there but preferred to make sandwiches in our room. Some issues about Corbigoe are listed below: 1. Expect to be asked to pay your full accommodation costs at book in time. 2. Staff are OK but not overly helpful 3. No lift, If you are on the top floor you will need to negotiate some pretty tough stairways ( alright for those who like the exercise). 4. Change of towels and bed linen are irregular. 5 TV set will get 2 or 3 watchable channels 6. Double room was adequate but ensuite toilet and shower required attention (mildew etc). On the plus side: Centrally located, close proximity to Pimlico station and local laundromat, Victoria Station about 1km away. (If you are concerned about the cost of "eating out" in Westminster City you can catch a local bus just outside, which will take you all the way to Campbell Town for cheap eating). Overall: As one reviewer pointed out, "You pay for what you get" My reason for flying half way around the world was to see London's sights and scenes on a budget. I used Corbigoe Hotel for the purpose of having a cheap place to rest my head each night. Although, I was far from enthused about Corbigoes service, it primarily suited my needs. Would I stay there again? Maybe, if Corbigoe can rectify its faults and upgrade its service (if not already) I cannot see why not.

Reviews.Title: “Turned Out Great !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After Reading all the scary reviews on this place(After being booked of course) We were freaked to say Just a Little. But not sure what anyone else "really" went though, BUT Our stay was Great. We were on the 1st floor and our room was very clean and Bigand it had it's own toliet/shower. The Bed and linens were clean and the were very polite and acommadating. It was cold and they offered and supplied extra covers and asked many times was everything was satisfactory. What a Pleasant stay it turned out to be. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Stay at own risk!”
Reviews.Author: CanuckGrl55
Reviews.Content: This was the most disgusting hotel I've ever had the displeasure of staying in! The only thing clean in my room was me...and that was after walking around London for 8 hours! The bathroom was a biohazard, the sheets were dirty and the staff were completely useless. In terms of safety/security: at one point during our stay, some random guys with keys to our room just waltzed in while we were changing to go out ("we" being 3 females in their 20's). When confronted we were told by the staff that the workers were told to wait but just wandered up to our room anyway. Fair enough but...um...but how did they get a key?!?! Oh and breakfast was great...if you're into stale cornflakes and white Tesco bread with a toaster. Avoid this hotel like the plague...it's a waste of your money and likely a genuine health hazard.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience, Do not consider this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sflMilano
Reviews.Content: Hello, We booked a room at Park Hotel, 64 Belgrave Road in London. When we arrived, the receptionist told us that our room was to another hotel: the Corbigoe Hotel at the same street at number 101, close to Pimlico tube station.
